job_title: Staff RN in Las Vegas, NV
cons: Not enough hours during hours during trsinibg

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The only benefit is that they are on 12 hour shifts.
cons:
Little structure on adult and youth units. RN's getting hurt and basically safety measures are being removed. The company removed mechanical restraints stating that it was the "new code" which was an utter lie to staff. Their ratios of patients to staff is dangerous. 
They expect you to physically hold a person for 2 hours, yet refuse to have staff around to do so. When a patient gets angry hope to god you get a hold of a doctor because when you call the code, no one shows up.  Avoid working residential. A patient could be harming themselves and you will have to do a physical hold on someone that probably has hep c while bleeding. Supervisors have little to no knowledge of state laws and shrug their shoulders and say "oh well".
No...you won't get a rasie, but you'll get a bonus which is questionable every time. Getting your last check feels as if you're a debt collector and they are avoiding you....best not to have any PTO left if your quitting.

job_title: Mental Hospital Technician in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Benefits start early... Other than that, I cannot think of any.
cons: Working here, I feel as if I am back in high school all over again. I am anxious and paranoid that my colleagues are talking about me. Toxic, cliquey co-workers are everywhere, whispering in each other’s ears. They make what should be friendly workplace competition seem hostile and dog-eat-dog. There’s always rumors or gossip floating around this place; misunderstanding, favoritism, and infighting are the norm.

review_title: Very informative and friendly staff and management team.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Very friendly employees and during orientation when team leaders came to talk to all the new hires they actually seemed like they care about all the employees and are very passionate about their job.
cons: During orientation, the pre recorded part were a little hard to understand, and made it a little hard to keep up.

cons: Some benefits are more expensive than other places I have worked before.
